business.headline: Sensex tumbles over 800 points. What's behind the bloodbath on Dalal Street?Stock market today: The Sensex had fallen 748.04 points to 78,470.01 at 1:18 pm, while the Nifty50 slipped 214.80 points to trade at 23,736.90. All broader market indices were also trading in negative territory.

Looking for high returns on investments? Check these 5 optionsBalancing risk and reward is essential for wealth creation. From equities to IPOs and P2P lending, explore these high-return investment options to align with your financial goals and risk appetite.

NACDAC Infra IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusThe Ghaziabad-based construction company's IPO, open from December 17 to December 19, offered shares in the price range of Rs 33-35 per share with a lot size of 4,000 shares.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Check latest GMP, price band and should you apply?Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: The Ahmedabad-based pharmaceutical company is offering shares in a price range of Rs 372-391, with a minimum application size of 38 equity shares and multiples thereafter.
Zerodha launches Margin Trading Facility: What it is and how it worksZerodha's Nithin Kamath introduces Margin Trading Facility, enabling investors to leverage funds for stock delivery.

Ventive Hospitality IPO opens: Check latest GMP, price band, and other detailsVentive Hospitality IPO: The subscription window closes on December 24, 2024. The basis of allotment is expected to be finalised by December 26, with shares credited to demat accounts by December 27.
Sensex, Nifty extend losses amid weak global cuesAt 10:28 am, the S&P BSE Sensex fell 274.86 points to 78,943.19, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 67.90 points to 23,883.80.
Rupee hits all-time low against US dollar. Why is it under pressure?The rupee surpassed its previous low of 85.0850 reached on Thursday and settled at 85.10 by 10:00 am.

Can you get a personal loan with low credit score? Check detailsWhile a low credit score may present challenges, using strategies like reduced DTI, and showing income stability, etc. can help secure a personal loan and improve your credit for the future.
Tata Consumer dismisses reports of Starbucks exiting India as baselessAn earlier report claimed that Starbucks was considering exiting the Indian market due to high costs and mounting losses.
Sensex ends nearly 1,000 points lower, Nifty below 24,000The Sensex ended 964.15 points lower at 79,218.05, while the Nifty50 settled 247.15 points lower at 23,951.70.

Missed ITR deadline? Here's your guide to filing belated return for AY 2024-25The last date to file a belated or revised ITR for FY 2023-24 is December 31, 2024—ensure all dues and penalties are paid to avoid additional charges.

Quick delivery, quicker success: Zepto founders top Hurun listZepto, established in 2021 by the duo of Kaivalya Vohra and Aadit Palicha, has revolutionised the quick-commerce sector with its 10-minute grocery delivery model.

US Fed rate cut decision: How will it impact Indian stock markets? The Sensex declined over 1,100 points and the Nifty fell below 24,000 after the US Federal Reserve's decision to cut interest rates by 0.25% to 4.5%, coupled with a hawkish outlook on future rate adjustments.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Latest GMP sees sharp rise; should you subscribe?Mamata Machinery, a leading manufacturer of packaging machines, seeks to raise Rs 179.39 crore from its offer for sale, with promoters selling up to 73.82 lakh equity shares at a face value of Rs 10 each.
Explained: Why SpiceJet share price jumped nearly 8% todaySpicejet share price: The airline's share price was up 7.48% to Rs 60.49 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 12:40 pm.

PMAY-U 2.0: Who can apply for affordable homes under Pradhan Mantri Awas YojanaPradhan Mantri Awas Yojana Urban 2.0 aims to provide affordable housing to one crore urban families, focusing on inclusive development through various housing schemes and subsidies.

Explained: Why Sensex fell over 1,000 points today and will bloodbath continue? Sensex and Nifty extended their losing streak as global markets plunged after the US Fed's cautious rate cut signal. Will the bears tighten their grip on Dalal Street, or is a reversal in sight?

Sanathan Textiles IPO opens for bidding: Check issue size, price band, latest GMPSanathan Textiles' Rs 550 crore IPO offers investment opportunities in a leading yarn manufacturer, with proceeds directed towards debt repayment and growth initiatives.

Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO share listing: Stocks list at 43% premium Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO share price: On the NSE, the shares opened at Rs 1,900 per share, marking a premium of 42.96% over the issue price.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Video: Moment when Jaipur crash sparked inferno that killed 9At least nine people were charred to death and 41 others sustained burn injuries in a massive fire that broke out after a truck loaded with a chemical collided with an LPG-carrying truck and some other vehicles near a fuel pump on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway. Police said the fire soon spread to the fuel pump in the city's Bhankrota area. CCTV footage accessed by India Today TV captured the moment when the truck crashed into other vehicles which caused the deadly incident. According to eyewitnesses, flames from nearly a kilometre away were seen as ambulances and fire brigade vehicles rushed towards the crash zone. A school van driver on his way to pick up students recounted with horror the sight of a man engulfed in flames.

'Saw man burning, broke bus windows to escape': Eyewitnesses on Jaipur horrorA massive fire broke out near a petrol pump on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway after a chemical-laden truck collided with an LPG tanker and several other vehicles. The incident left 9 people dead.

Former Haryana Chief Minister Om Prakash Chautala dies at 89 Om Prakash Chautala, 89, former Chief Minister of Haryana, suffered a cardiac arrest at his Gurugram home and was immediately rushed to hospital, but could not be saved.

Hold the gun: R Ashwin wishes Washington Sundar with viral Thalapathy Vijay lineRavichandran Ashwin wished Washington Sundar the best, hinting at passing the baton to the fellow off-spinner. Ashwin used a viral line from Thalapathy Vijay's recent blockbuster Tamil film, GOAT, to convey the message.

Watch: Diljit Dosanjh's bold response to advisory at Mumbai concertDiljit Dosanjh savagely replied to the advisory against him ahead of his Mumbai concert. The actor-singer assured fans to not worry and promised double fun.

Opposition boycotts Speaker's tea meet as tumultuous Parliament session endsAmid an uproar over the Ambedkar issue, both Houses adopted a motion to send One Nation One Election bills to a joint parliamentary committee for further scrutiny.

RSS chief jabs aspiring 'leaders of Hindus' over temple-mosque disputesMohan Bhagwat's remarks stressed India's unity in diversity, condemning divisive tactics. He called for an inclusive, harmonious model, urging the country to set an example of coexistence for the world.

Viduthalai 2 X review: Fans praise Vijay Sethupathi, say 'national award loading'Viduthalai Part 2 starring Vijay Sethupathi has been receiving love from fans. Directed by Vetri Maaran, the movie released in theatres on December 20.

Amitabh Bachchan joins Aishwarya-Abhishek to cheer for Aaradhya at school eventAmitabh Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan, and Aishwarya Rai cheered for Aaradhya at her school's annual day. Shah Rukh Khan's son AbRam's was also a part of the performance.

Devendra Fadnavis's big claim: 'Urban naxals' involved in Rahul Gandhi's yatraDevendra Fadnavis said the 'urban naxals' held a meeting in Kathmandu in November, just ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly elections, to trigger unrest in the state.

Delhi man upset over fresher not calling him 'sir' on LinkedIn. Post sparks debateSaket, a self-described writer and columnist, shared his displeasure after a fresh graduate from his alma mater reached out to him on LinkedIn.

Vanvaas review: Nana Patekar, Utkarsh Sharma's film is a dull version of BaghbanReleased-Fri Dec 20, 2024Vanvaas, starring Nana Patekar and Utkarsh Sharma, explores the deteriorating bond between parents and children, reminiscent of Baghban but with a deeper twist. Despite its noble intentions, the film struggles with execution and fails to evoke the emotional depth it aims for.
Bajaj Chetak 35 Series electric scooter launched at Rs 1.20 lakhBajaj Auto has sold more than 3,00,000 units of the Chetak electric scooter till now.

After Priyanka Gandhi, BJP MP makes a statement with '1984' bagBJP MP Aparajita Sarangi gifted Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi a bag referencing the 1984 anti-Sikh riots after her earlier statement in Parliament with bags featuring Palestinian motifs, sparking political controversy.

One Nation One Election bill referred to joint parliamentary panel According to the Lok Sabha secretariat, a joint parliamentary committee, consisting of 27 Lok Sabha and 12 Rajya Sabha MPs, will scrutinise the One Nation One Election bill and send its recommendation to the Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla.
Rupee hits all-time low against US dollar. Why is it under pressure?The rupee surpassed its previous low of 85.0850 reached on Thursday and settled at 85.10 by 10:00 am.
Can making a vision board really help you achieve your goals for 2025?A vision board is a creative visual representation of one's goals, dreams, and aspirations.

How Kejriwal's Ambedkar poser for Naidu-Nitish hits Modi govt where it hurtsThe AAP leader, who faces the BJP in Delhi elections, has asked the crucial NDA partners to 'deeply reflect' in light of Amit Shah's remarks on B.R. Ambedkar

Woman slaps 'drunk' man over 26 times on Pune bus for allegedly harassing herA sports teacher's bold response to harassment on a Pune bus went viral. Despite the man's apology, her firm stand underscored a growing demand for accountability in public spaces.

Two jails, two nooses, one dream: How Bismil and Ashfaqullah ignited a revolutionRam Prasad Bismil and Ashfaqullah Khan shared an unshakeable friendship that defied religious divides and colonial oppression. Their daring Kakori Train Robbery became a symbol of India's fight for freedom, ending in their heroic sacrifice that inspired generations.

Watch: SRK enjoys Levitating X Woh Ladki Jo mashupShah Rukh Khan attended the annual day event at Dhirubhai Ambani International School in Mumbai. The actor who was present with his daughter Suhana and wife Gauri to cheer for his son AbRam, was seen vibing on Levitating X Woh Ladki Jo mashup.

Strict laws for women's welfare, not to threaten, extort husbands: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court ruled that a divorced wife cannot seek permanent alimony to equalise wealth with her ex-husband, emphasising that maintenance is intended to ensure a standard of living.

Fasting farm leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's life hanging by a thread: DoctorsDoctors said that the health condition of Dallewal, is on a hunger strike since November 26, is deteriorating and his "life is hanging by a threat". They said that the farm leader is at the risk of cardiac arrest and multi-organ failure as well.
As UPI frauds are on a rise, BharatPe launches new feature called Shield: What is it, how to use itShield is available on the BharatPe app, which can be downloaded on both Android and iOS devices.

Arijit Singh Mumbai, Delhi show tickets go live: Check prices, dates, how to bookTickets for Arijit Singh's highly anticipated shows in Delhi and Mumbai are now available on Zomato. Prices start at Rs 6,500 and go up to Rs 75,000.

Thalapathy Vijay loved Varun Dhawan's work in Baby John: Director KaleesIn an interview, director Kalees revealed that Thalapathy Vijay was impressed by Baby John and highly appreciated Varun Dhawan's performance. Baby John is an adaptation of the 2016 Tamil film in which Vijay played the lead role.

Despite its noble intentions, the film struggles with execution and fails to evoke the emotional depth it aims for.

BB 18 Day 73: Shrutika Arjun becomes Time God, Chum Darang questions her gameplayBigg Boss 18 delivered high-voltage drama as Shrutika Arjun became the new Time God, sparking chaos within the house. Her priorities were called into question by the housemates, leading to intense confrontations and emotional breakdowns.

sports.headline: World Cup for red-ball players: South Africa's Bavuma sets sights on WTC finalSouth Africa captain Temba Bavuma has firmly set his sights on reaching their first-ever World Test Championship Final, scheduled to be held at Lord's in June next year.

Amorim has "no regrets" over Rashford snub after United's Carabao Cup exitAmid mounting speculation, Ruben Amorim defended Marcus Rashford's exclusion from Manchester United's Carabao Cup squad despite a dramatic 4-3 loss to Tottenham Hotspur.

Shaw is his own enemy: Mumbai Cricket breaks silence on Vijay Hazare snubThe Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) official has dismissed Prithvi Shaw's emotional reaction to being left out of the Vijay Hazare Trophy squad, attributing the decision to his repeated disciplinary lapses.

From sapno ka sheher to WPL deal: MI's Akshita set to take flightExclusive: Mumbai Indians' cricketer Akshita Maheshwari talked to IndiaToday.in and spoke about her WPL deal, her admiration for Jasprit Bumrah, Bhuvneshwar Kumar. In the auction that took place in Bengaluru, MI picked Maheshwari for Rs 20 lakhs.

Manchester United ousted by Tottenham in Carabao Cup despite Amad Diallo-showRuben Amorim endured his first major setback as Manchester United manager, with his side crashing out of the Carabao Cup after a thrilling 4-3 defeat to Tottenham Hotspur, despite a spirited effort for a late comeback driven by the likes of Amad Diallo and Joshua Zirkzee.

Australia selector explains 'very difficult decision' of dropping Nathan McSweeneyAustralia's George Bailey defended the bold decision to drop Nathan McSweeney for rising star Sam Konstas, emphasising the move was aimed at fortifying the struggling top order against India's pace attack during the high-pressure Boxing Day Test.

Who is Sam Konstas? 19-year-old Aussie opener set for Boxing Day Test debutAustralia vs India, Boxing Day Test: 19-year-old Sam Konstas is all set to become only the third Australian man after Pat Cummins and Ashton Agar in the last 40 years to make his Test debut as a teenager. The New South Wales opener has shown a lot of promise with the bat in the 2024-25 season.

Bangladesh clinch 1st-ever 3-0 T20I sweep vs West Indies after Jaker specialBangladesh completed a stunning redemption arc, sweeping West Indies 3-0 in the T20I series after an 80-run victory in the final match, powered by Jaker Ali's brilliance and Rishad Hossain's exceptional bowling performance in St. Vincent.

Australia drop Nathan McSweeney for Boxing Day Test, add teenage opener to squadBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Australia named a 15-man squad for the last two tests against India on Friday. R Ashwin responds to Virat Kohli's tribute, reveals poignant MCG messageRavichandran Ashwin responded to Virat Kohli's heartfelt retirement tribute and also emphasised that as India prepares for their Boxing Day Test against Australia at the MCG, the spinner will be there with him in spirits as he walks on to bat. This also reminded fans about their iconic 2022 T20 World Cup partnership against Pakistan.

Ashwin retires: India's greatest match-winner deserved more respectRavichandran Ashwin, India's spin wizard, retired without any farewell spell, a packed stadium, or guard of honour. Ashwin did not even get to display his brilliance on the field one final time. For a player of his stature, the farewell was far from fitting.

Ashwin was ready to evolve all the time, made him stand out: Ravi ShastriRavi Shastri hailed Ravichandran Ashwin's career, emphasising his adaptability and tactical brilliance, which set him apart as a cricketing legend. Ashwin's sudden retirement left the cricketing world reflecting on his illustrious contributions across formats.

Babar Azam, Rizwan's grit leads Pakistan to seal series in Cape TownPakistan sealed a commanding ODI series win against South Africa with an 81-run victory, driven by stellar performances from Babar Azam, Mohammad Rizwan, Kamran Ghulam, and Shaheen Afridi, showcasing their dominance ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

How Smriti Mandhana inspired Team India to end 5-year drought at home IND-W vs WI-W: Smriti Mandhana, who led India in Harmanpreet Kaur's career, talked about the importance of winning a T20I series on home soil. On Thursday, India beat the West Indies in the deciding game to claim the series 2-1.

Richa Ghosh happy to follow footsteps of Smriti Mandhana after series win vs WIPlayer of the match in India's T20I series decider vs West Indies - Richa Ghosh - said that she was happy to follow in the footsteps of Smriti Mandhana. Richa credited Mandhana for setting the stage with aggressive batting.

Jasprit Bumrah is the right-handed Wasim Akram: Justin LangerFormer Australia head coach Justin Langer has compared Jasprit Bumrah to Wasim Akram. Langer said that he would have hated to face Bumrah in his playing days.

India Women thrash West Indies in series decider to end 5-year-long wait IND-W vs WI-W: India won their Women's T20I series against West Indies after winning the series decider by 100 runs on Thursday in Navi Mumbai. Smriti Mandhana and Richa Ghosh starred for India in the high-scoring encounter.

Shami's BGT hopes take hit. Pacer gets left out of Bengal's Vijay Hazare openerIndia pacer Mohammed Shami's Border-Gavaskar Trophy hopes took a massive hit as the pacer was sidelined from Bengal's Vijay Hazare Trophy opener against Delhi. PTI reported that the pacer's knee injury had flared up once again and that's why he was sidelined.

Did R Ashwin time his retirement right? | Sledging Room S2 Ep 68Ravichandran Ashwin's decision to announce his retirement shocked the cricketing world. While many were taken aback by the announcement, it appears that Ashwin had carefully considered his decision.

Who is Liam Lawson? F1 driver who joins Max Verstappen at Red BullRed Bull announced on December 19 that Liam Lawson will be replacing Sergio Perez in the 2025 season. Who is Liam Lawson, the 22-year-old youngster set to pair 4-time World Champion Max Verstappen?

Mandhana shatters multiple records with hat-trick of T20I 50s: Stat PackIND-W vs WI-W: Smriti Mandhana blasted her way to scoring 77 runs off 47 balls with 13 fours and a six in the series decider against the West Indies on Thursday at the Dr DY Patil Sports Academy in Navi Mumbai.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
